label: FGMS001
info_overview:
The Fibaro Motion Sensor is a universal Z-Wave multi-sensor. Along with detecting motion the device measures the temperature and light
intensity.

The sensor has a built-in accelerometer to detect any tampering of the device. The Fibaro Motion Sensor is battery powered device and designed to be installed quckly and easily on any surface.
info_inclusion:
1. Insert the battery into the Fibaro Motion Sensor. Enclosure lock is marked with a dot. Make sure the device is located within the direct range of the main controller.
  2. Set the main controller into the learning mode (see main controller’s operating manual).
  3. Quickly, triple click the B-button - LED diode will glow blue.
  4. Fibaro Motion Sensor will be detected and included in the Z-Wave network.
  5. Wait for the main controller to configure the sensor.
  6. If necessary, wake up the Motion Sensor by triple clicking the B-button.
  7. LED diode will glow blue to confirm the sensor woke up, and then wait for the main controller to configure the sensor
info_exclusion:
1. Set the main controller into the exclusion mode (see main controller’s operating manual).
  2. Quickly, triple click the B-button - LED diode will glow blue.
  3. Fibaro Motion Sensor will be excluded from the Z-Wave network.
info_wakeup: Quickly, triple click the B-button - LED diode will glow blue.

      The parameter determines the command frames sent in 1-st association group, assigned to PIR sensor.
      0 - BASIC ON and BASIC OFF command frames sent in Basic Command Class.
      1 - only the BASIC ON command frame sent in Basic Command Class.

      The value of 255 allows to turn ON a device. In case of the Dimmer, the value of 255 means turning ON at the last memorized state, e.g. the Dimmer turned ON at 30% and turned OFF using the value of 255, and then turned OFF, will be turned ON at 30%, i.e. the last memorized state.
      Available settings: 0 - 255
      Default setting: 255
      Parameter size: 1 [byte]<\/p>", "size": 1, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 255, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 255, "options": [] }, { "id": 16, "label": "BASIC OFF command frame value", "description": "The value of 0 allows to turn OFF a device.", "overview": "

      The command frame sent at the moment of motion alarm cancellation, after the cancellation delay time, specified in parameter 6, has passed. The value of 0 allows to turn a device OFF while the value of 255 allows to turn ON a device. In case of the Dimmer, the value of 255 means turning ON at the last memorized state, e.g. the Dimmer turned ON at 30% and turned OFF using the value of 255, and then turned OFF, will be turned ON at 30%, i.e. the last memorized state.

      Default setting: 0
      Parameter size: 1 [byte]<\/p>", "size": 1, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 0, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 255, "options": [] }, { "id": 20, "label": "Tamper Sensitivity", "description": "The parameter determines the changes in forces.", "overview": "

      The parameter determines the chages in forces acting on the Fibaro Motion Sensor resulting in tamper alarm being reported - g-force acceleration.
      Available settigs: 0 - 122 (0.08 - 2g; multiply by 0.016g; 0 = tamper inactive)
      Default setting: 15 (0.224g)
      Parameter size: 1 [byte]\u00a0<\/p>", "size": 1, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 15, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 122, "options": [] }, { "id": 22, "label": "Tamper - alarm cancellation delay", "description": "Time period after which a tamper alarm will be cancelled.", "overview": "

      Time period after which a tamper alarm will be cancelled. Another tampering detected durig the countdown to cancellation will not extend the delay.
      Available settings: 1 - 65535
      Default setting: 30 (seconds)
      Parameter size: 2 [bytes]\u00a0<\/p>", "size": 2, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 30, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 65535, "options": [] }, { "id": 24, "label": "Tamper Operating Modes", "description": "The parameter determines the behaviour of tamper and how it reports.", "overview": "

      The parameter determines the behaviour of tamper and how it reports.\u00a0<\/p>

      1. Tamper alarm is reported in Sensor Alarm command class \/ Cancellation is not reported.<\/li>
      2. Tamper alarm is reported in Sensor Alarm command class \/ Cancellation is reported in Sensor Alarm commad class after the time period set in parameter 22 (Tamper Alarm Cancellation Delay) 2 - Tamper alarm is reported in Sensor Alarm command class \/ Cancellation is not reported.\u00a0Sensor\u2019s orientation in space is reported in Fibar Commad Class after the time period set in paramer 22.<\/li>
      3. Tamper alarm is reported in Sensor Alarm command class \/ Cancellation is reported in Sensor Alarm commad class after the time period set in parameter 22. Sensor\u2019s orientation in space is reported in Fibar Commad Class after the time period set in paramer 22. \u00a0<\/li>
      4. The maximum level of vibrations recorded in the time period set in parameter 22 is reported. Reports stop being sent when the vibrations cease. The reports are sent in Sensor Alarm command class. Value displayed in the \u201cvalue\u201d field (0 - 100) depends on the vibrations force. Reports to the association groups are sent using Sensor Alarm command class. \u00a0
        Available settings: 0 or 255 Default setting: 0 Parameter size: 1 [byte]\u00a0<\/li> <\/ol>", "size": 1, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 0, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 255, "options": [ { "value": 0, "label": "Tamper Report\/No Cancellation Report" }, { "value": 1, "label": "Tamper and Cancellation Report" }, { "value": 2, "label": "Tamper\/No cancellation plus Orientation in space" }, { "value": 3, "label": "Tamper\/Cancellation plus Orientation in space" }, { "value": 4, "label": "Max level of vibrations recorded (Earthquake)" } ] }, { "id": 26, "label": "Tamper Alarm Broadcast Mode", "description": "Alarm frame will or will not be sent in broadcast mode.", "overview": "

        The parameter determines whether the tamper alarm frame will or will not be sent in broadcast mode. Alarm frames sent in broadcast mode may be received by all of the devices within communication range (if they accept such frames).<\/p>

        0 - Tamper alarm is not sent in broadcast mode.<\/p>

        1 - Tamper alarm sent in broadcast mode.<\/p>

        Default setting: 0
        Parameter size: 1 [byte]\u00a0<\/p>", "size": 1, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 0, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 255, "options": [ { "value": 0, "label": "Tamper alarm is not sent in broadcast mode." }, { "value": 1, "label": "Tamper alarm sent in broadcast mode." } ] }, { "id": 40, "label": "Illumination Report Threshold", "description": "Change in level of light intensity resulting in illumination report.", "overview": "

        The parameter determines the change in light intensity level resulting in illumination report being sent to the main controller.<\/p>

        Available settings: 0 - 65535 (1 - 65535 lux; 0 = reports are not sent)<\/p>

        Default setting: 200 (200 lux) Parameter size: 2 [byte]\u00a0<\/p>", "size": 2, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 200, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 65535, "options": [] }, { "id": 42, "label": "Illumination Reports Interval", "description": "Time interval between consecutive illumination reports.", "overview": "

        Time interval between consecutive illumination reports. The reports are sent even if there are no changes in the light intensity.<\/p>

        The parameter determines the change in level of temperature resulting in temperature report being sent to the main controller.
        Available settings: 0 - 255 (0.1 - 25.5oC; 0 = reports are not sent)
        Default setting: 10 (1oC) Parameter size: 1 [byte]<\/p>", "size": 1, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 10, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 255, "options": [] }, { "id": 62, "label": "Interval of Temperature Measuring", "description": "The parameter determines how often the temperature will be measured.", "overview": "

        The parameter determines how often the temperature will be measured. The shorter the time, the more frequently the temperature will be measured, but the battery life will shorten.
        Available settings: 0 - 65535 (1 - 65535 seconds; 0 = temperature will not be measured)
        Default setting: 900 (900 seconds)
        Parameter size: 2 [bytes]<\/p>", "size": 2, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 900, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 65535, "options": [] }, { "id": 64, "label": "Temperature Reports Interval", "description": "How often temperature reports will be sent to the main controller.", "overview": "

        The parameter determines how often the temperature reports will be sent to the main controller.
        Available settings: 0 - 65535 (1 - 65535 seconds; 0 = reports are not sent)
        Default setting: 0 Parameter size: 2 [byte]\u00a0<\/p>", "size": 2, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 0, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 65535, "options": [] }, { "id": 66, "label": "Temperature Offset", "description": "The value to be added to the actual measured temperature.", "overview": "

        The value to be added to the actual temperature, measured by the sensor (temperature compensation).
        Available settings: 0 - 100 (0 to 100oC) or 64536 - 65535 (-100 to -0.10oC)
        Default setting: 0 Parameter size: 2 [bytes]<\/p>", "size": 2, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 0, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 65535, "options": [] }, { "id": 80, "label": "LED Signalling Mode", "description": "Way in which LED diode behaves after motion has been detected.", "overview": "

        The parameter determines the way in which LED diode behaves after motion has been detected.
        Values from 1 to 9 = single long blink at the moment of reporting motion. No other motion will be indicated until alarm is cancelled.
        Values from 10 to 18 = single long blink at the moment of reporting motion and one short blink each time the motion is detected again.

parameters.label: Motion Sensor's Sensitivity
parameters.description: The lower the value, the more sensitive the PIR sensor.
parameters.overview: The lower the value, the more sensitive the PIR sensor. Available settings: 8 - 255.

parameters.label: Motion Sensor's Blind Time (Insensitive)
parameters.description: Period of time through which the PIR sensor is “blind”.
parameters.overview:
Period of time through which the PIR sensor is “blind” (insensitive) to motion. After this time period the PIR sensor will be again able to detect motion. The longer the insensitivity period, the longer the battery life. If the sensor is required to detect motion quickly, the time period may be shortened. The time of insensitivity should be shorter that the time period set in parameter 6.
Available settings: 0 - 15
Formula to calculate the time: time [s] = 0.5 x (value + 1)
Default setting: 15 (8 seconds)
Parameter size: 1 [byte]

parameters.label: PIR Sensor’s “PULSE COUNTER”
parameters.description: Sets the number of moves required for the PIR sensor to report motion.
parameters.overview:
Sets the number of moves required for the PIR sensor to report motion. The lower the value, the less sensitive the PIR sensor. It’s not recommended to modify this parameter settings.
Available settings: 0 - 3
Formula to calculate the number of pulses: pulses = (value + 1) Default setting: 1 (2 pulses)
Parameter size: 1 [byte]

parameters.label: PIR Sensor’s “WINDOW TIME”
parameters.description: The higher the value, the more sensitive the PIR sensor.
parameters.overview:
Period of time during which the number of moves set in parameter 3 must be detected in order for the PIR sensor to report motion. The higher the value, the more sensitive the PIR sensor. It’s not recommended to modify this parameter setting.
Available settings: 0 - 3
Formula to calculate the time: time [s] = 4 x (value + 1)
Default setting: 2 (12 seconds)
Parameter size: 1 [byte]

parameters.label: Motion Alarm Cancellation Delay
parameters.description: Period of time after wich Motion alarm will be cancelled.
parameters.overview:
Motion alarm will be cancelled in the main controller and the associated devices after the period of time set in this parameter. Any motion detected during the cancellation delay time countdown will result in the countdown being restarted. In case of small values, below 10 seconds, the value of parameter 2 must be modified (PIR sensor’s “Blind Time”).
Available settings: 1 - 65535
Default setting: 30 (30 seconds)
Parameter size: 2 [bytes]

parameters.label: PIR Sensor Operating Mode
parameters.description: The parameter determines the part of day in which the PIR sensor will be active.
parameters.overview: The parameter determines the part of day in which the PIR sensor will be active. This parameter influences only the motion reports and associations. Tamper, light intensity and temperature measurements will be still active, regardless of this parameter settings. 0 - PIR sensor always active 1 - PIR sensor active during the day only 2 - PIR sensor active during the night only. Default setting: 0 Parameter size: 1 [byte]

options.label: PIR sensor active during the day only
PIR sensor active during the night only

parameters.label: Night / Day
parameters.description: The parameter defines the difference between night and day.
parameters.overview: The parameter defines the difference between night and day, in terms of light intensity, used in parameter 8. Available settings: 1 - 65535 Default setting: 200 (200 lux) Parameter size: 2 [bytes]

parameters.label: BASIC command class configuration
parameters.description: Determines the command frames sent in 1-st association group.
parameters.overview:
The parameter determines the command frames sent in 1-st association group, assigned to PIR sensor.
0 - BASIC ON and BASIC OFF command frames sent in Basic Command Class.
1 - only the BASIC ON command frame sent in Basic Command Class.
2 - only the BASIC OFF command frame sent in Basic CommandClass.
Values of BASIC ON and BASIC OFF command frames may be modified by dedicated parameters.
Default setting: 0 Parameter size: 1 [byte]

options.label: BASIC ON and BASIC OFF
options.overview: BASIC ON and BASIC OFF command frames sent in Basic Command Class.

options.label: Only the BASIC ON
options.overview: Only the BASIC ON command frame sent in Basic Command Class.

options.label: Only the BASIC OFF
options.overview: Only the BASIC OFF command frame sent in Basic Command Class.

parameters.label: BASIC ON command frame value
parameters.description: The value of 255 allows to turn ON a device.
parameters.overview:
The value of 255 allows to turn ON a device. In case of the Dimmer, the value of 255 means turning ON at the last memorized state, e.g. the Dimmer turned ON at 30% and turned OFF using the value of 255, and then turned OFF, will be turned ON at 30%, i.e. the last memorized state.
Available settings: 0 - 255
Default setting: 255
Parameter size: 1 [byte]

parameters.label: BASIC OFF command frame value
parameters.description: The value of 0 allows to turn OFF a device.
parameters.overview:
The command frame sent at the moment of motion alarm cancellation, after the cancellation delay time, specified in parameter 6, has passed. The value of 0 allows to turn a device OFF while the value of 255 allows to turn ON a device. In case of the Dimmer, the value of 255 means turning ON at the last memorized state, e.g. the Dimmer turned ON at 30% and turned OFF using the value of 255, and then turned OFF, will be turned ON at 30%, i.e. the last memorized state.
Available settings: 0 - 255
Default setting: 0
Parameter size: 1 [byte]

parameters.label: Tamper Sensitivity
parameters.description: The parameter determines the changes in forces.
parameters.overview:
The parameter determines the chages in forces acting on the Fibaro Motion Sensor resulting in tamper alarm being reported - g-force acceleration.
Available settigs: 0 - 122 (0.08 - 2g; multiply by 0.016g; 0 = tamper inactive)
Default setting: 15 (0.224g)
Parameter size: 1 [byte]

parameters.label: Tamper - alarm cancellation delay
parameters.description: Time period after which a tamper alarm will be cancelled.
parameters.overview:
Time period after which a tamper alarm will be cancelled. Another tampering detected durig the countdown to cancellation will not extend the delay.
Available settings: 1 - 65535
Default setting: 30 (seconds)
Parameter size: 2 [bytes]

parameters.label: Tamper Operating Modes
parameters.description: The parameter determines the behaviour of tamper and how it reports.
parameters.overview:
The parameter determines the behaviour of tamper and how it reports. 

  1. Tamper alarm is reported in Sensor Alarm command class / Cancellation is not reported.
  2. Tamper alarm is reported in Sensor Alarm command class / Cancellation is reported in Sensor Alarm commad class after the time period set in parameter 22 (Tamper Alarm Cancellation Delay) 2 - Tamper alarm is reported in Sensor Alarm command class / Cancellation is not reported. Sensor’s orientation in space is reported in Fibar Commad Class after the time period set in paramer 22.
  3. Tamper alarm is reported in Sensor Alarm command class / Cancellation is reported in Sensor Alarm commad class after the time period set in parameter 22. Sensor’s orientation in space is reported in Fibar Commad Class after the time period set in paramer 22.  
  4. The maximum level of vibrations recorded in the time period set in parameter 22 is reported. Reports stop being sent when the vibrations cease. The reports are sent in Sensor Alarm command class. Value displayed in the “value” field (0 - 100) depends on the vibrations force. Reports to the association groups are sent using Sensor Alarm command class.  
    Available settings: 0 or 255 Default setting: 0 Parameter size: 1 [byte]

options.label: Tamper Report/No Cancellation Report
options.overview: Tamper alarm is reported in Sensor Alarm command class / Cancellation is not reported.

options.label: Tamper and Cancellation Report
options.overview: Tamper alarm is reported in Sensor Alarm command class / Cancellation is reported in Sensor Alarm commad class after the time period set in parameter 22 (Tamper Alarm Cancellation Delay).

options.label: Tamper/No cancellation plus Orientation in space
options.overview: Tamper alarm is reported in Sensor Alarm command class / Cancellation is not reported. Sensor’s orientation in space is reported in Fibaro Commad Class after the time period set in paramer 22.

options.label: Tamper/Cancellation plus Orientation in space
options.overview: Tamper alarm is reported in Sensor Alarm command class / Cancellation is reported in Sensor Alarm commad class after the time period set in parameter 22. Sensor’s orientation in space is reported in Fibar Commad Class after the time period set in parameter 22.

options.label: Max level of vibrations recorded (Earthquake)
options.overview: The maximum level of vibrations recorded in the time period set in parameter 22 is reported. Reports stop being sent when the vibrations cease. The reports are sent in Sensor Alarm command class. Value displayed in the “value” field (0 - 100) depends on the vibrations force. Reports to the association groups are sent using Sensor Alarm command class.

parameters.label: Tamper Alarm Broadcast Mode
parameters.description: Alarm frame will or will not be sent in broadcast mode.
parameters.overview:
The parameter determines whether the tamper alarm frame will or will not be sent in broadcast mode. Alarm frames sent in broadcast mode may be received by all of the devices within communication range (if they accept such frames).

0 - Tamper alarm is not sent in broadcast mode.

1 - Tamper alarm sent in broadcast mode.

Default setting: 0
Parameter size: 1 [byte]

options.label: Tamper alarm is not sent in broadcast mode.
Tamper alarm sent in broadcast mode.

parameters.label: Illumination Report Threshold
parameters.description: Change in level of light intensity resulting in illumination report.
parameters.overview:
The parameter determines the change in light intensity level resulting in illumination report being sent to the main controller.

Available settings: 0 - 65535 (1 - 65535 lux; 0 = reports are not sent)

Default setting: 200 (200 lux) Parameter size: 2 [byte]

parameters.label: Illumination Reports Interval
parameters.description: Time interval between consecutive illumination reports.
parameters.overview:
Time interval between consecutive illumination reports. The reports are sent even if there are no changes in the light intensity.

Available settings: 0 - 65535 (1 - 65535 seconds; 0 = reports are not sent)

Default setting: 0 (no reports) Parameter size: 2 [bytes]

parameters.label: Temperature Report Threshold
parameters.description: Change in level of temperature resulting in temperature report.
parameters.overview:
The parameter determines the change in level of temperature resulting in temperature report being sent to the main controller.
Available settings: 0 - 255 (0.1 - 25.5oC; 0 = reports are not sent)
Default setting: 10 (1oC) Parameter size: 1 [byte]

parameters.label: Interval of Temperature Measuring
parameters.description: The parameter determines how often the temperature will be measured.
parameters.overview:
The parameter determines how often the temperature will be measured. The shorter the time, the more frequently the temperature will be measured, but the battery life will shorten.
Available settings: 0 - 65535 (1 - 65535 seconds; 0 = temperature will not be measured)
Default setting: 900 (900 seconds)
Parameter size: 2 [bytes]

parameters.label: Temperature Reports Interval
parameters.description: How often temperature reports will be sent to the main controller.
parameters.overview:
The parameter determines how often the temperature reports will be sent to the main controller.
Available settings: 0 - 65535 (1 - 65535 seconds; 0 = reports are not sent)
Default setting: 0 Parameter size: 2 [byte]

parameters.label: Temperature Offset
parameters.description: The value to be added to the actual measured temperature.
parameters.overview:
The value to be added to the actual temperature, measured by the sensor (temperature compensation).
Available settings: 0 - 100 (0 to 100oC) or 64536 - 65535 (-100 to -0.10oC)
Default setting: 0 Parameter size: 2 [bytes]

parameters.label: LED Signalling Mode
parameters.description: Way in which LED diode behaves after motion has been detected.
parameters.overview:
The parameter determines the way in which LED diode behaves after motion has been detected.
Values from 1 to 9 = single long blink at the moment of reporting motion. No other motion will be indicated until alarm is cancelled.
Values from 10 to 18 = single long blink at the moment of reporting motion and one short blink each time the motion is detected again.
Values from 19 to 26 = single long blink at the moment of reporting motion and two short blinks each time the motion is detected again.

options.label: LED colour depends on the temperature.
Flashlight mode - LED glows white 10 seconds
LED colour depends on the temperature
Flashlight mode
options.overview: Flashlight mode - LED glows in white through 10 seconds.

options.label: LED colour depends on the temperature

parameters.label: LED Brightness
parameters.description: The parameter determines the brightness of LED when indicating motion.
parameters.overview:
The parameter determines the brightness of LED when indicating motion.
Available settings: 0 - 100 (1 - 100%; 0 = brightness determined by the ambient lighting - see parameters 82 and 83)
Default setting: 50 Parameter size: 1 [byte]

parameters.label: Lower Ambient Illumination Level
parameters.description: Below which LED brightness is set to 1%
parameters.overview:
The parameter is relevant only when the parameter 81 is set to 0.

Available settings: 0 to parameter 83 value
Default setting: 100 (100 lux)
Parameter size: 2 [bytes]

parameters.label: Upper Ambient Illumination Level
parameters.description: Above which LED brightness is set to 100%
parameters.overview:
The parameter is relevant only when the parameter 81 is set to 0.

Available settings: parameter 82 value to 65535
Default setting: 1 000 (1 000 lux)
Parameter size: 2 [bytes]

parameters.label: Min Temperature Resulting in Blue LED Illumination
parameters.description: This parameter is relevant only when parameter 80 has been properly configured.
parameters.overview:
This parameter is relevant only when parameter 80 has been properly configured.
Available settings: 0 to parameter 87 value (degrees celsius)
Default setting: 18 (18oC)
Parameter size: 1 [byte]

parameters.label: Max Temperature Resulting in Red LED Illumination
parameters.description: This parameter is relevant only when parameter 80 has been properly configured.
parameters.overview:
This parameter is relevant only when parameter 80 has been properly configured.
Available settings: parameter 86 value to 255 (degrees celsius)
Default setting: 28 (28oC)
Parameter size: 1 [byte]

parameters.label: LED indicating Tamper Alarm
parameters.description: Indicating mode resembles a police car (white, red and blue).
parameters.overview:
Indicating mode resembles a police car (white, red and blue).

0 - LED does not indicate tamper alarm.

1 - LED indicates tamper alarm.

Default setting: 1 Parameter size: 1 [byte]

options.label: LED does not indicate tamper alarm.

commandclass.name: NO_OPERATION
commandclass.label: No Operation - used for PINGing a device.
